3-1/2-year-old.context: The patient is a 3-1/2-year-old child with history of recurrent otitis media as well as snoring and chronic mouth breathing.

recurrent otitis media.context: The patient is a 3-1/2-year-old child with history of recurrent otitis media as well as snoring and chronic mouth breathing.

snoring.context: The patient is a 3-1/2-year-old child with history of recurrent otitis media as well as snoring and chronic mouth breathing.

chronic mouth breathing.context: The patient is a 3-1/2-year-old child with history of recurrent otitis media as well as snoring and chronic mouth breathing.

bleeding.context: Risks and benefits of surgery including risk of bleeding, general anesthesia, tympanic membrane perforation as well as persistent recurrent otitis media were discussed with the patient and parents and informed consent was signed by the parents.

general anesthesia.context: Risks and benefits of surgery including risk of bleeding, general anesthesia, tympanic membrane perforation as well as persistent recurrent otitis media were discussed with the patient and parents and informed consent was signed by the parents.

tympanic membrane perforation.context: Risks and benefits of surgery including risk of bleeding, general anesthesia, tympanic membrane perforation as well as persistent recurrent otitis media were discussed with the patient and parents and informed consent was signed by the parents.

persistent recurrent otitis media.context: Risks and benefits of surgery including risk of bleeding, general anesthesia, tympanic membrane perforation as well as persistent recurrent otitis media were discussed with the patient and parents and informed consent was signed by the parents.

wax.context: The left ear was then draped in a clean fashion. Under microscopic visualization, the ear canal was cleaned of the wax.

no fluid.context: Under microscopic visualization, the ear canal was cleaned of the wax. Myringotomy incision was made in the anterior inferior quadrant. There was no fluid in the middle ear space.

Micron Bobbin tube.context: A Micron Bobbin tube was easily placed.

Floxin drops.context: Floxin drops were placed in the ear.

enlarged adenoids.context: The patient was then found to have enlarged adenoids.

bleeding points.context: Reexamining the oropharynx, small bleeding points were cauterized with the Coblator.

stomach contents.context: Stomach contents were then aspirated with saline sump.

stable condition.context: The patient was woken up from anesthesia, extubated and brought to recovery room in stable condition.
